Control Categories

The Control Categories section is used to define access groups that determine what different users or clients can see and do inside Unit Master.

What are Control Categories?

Control Categories are configuration groups that help the system administrator manage visibility and access rules across Unit Master. Instead of configuring each user or client individually, you create a category and link it to multiple users or clients.

Once a control category is assigned to a client or user, it normally stays the same and ensures consistent behaviour for access rights and restrictions.

Control categories

The Control Categories page helps the system administrator manage what different users or clients can see, do, or access inside Unit Master.

These settings define control groups or categories that can be linked to clients or users. Once configured and assigned to a new client, they typically do not change.

This ensures consistent access behaviour and standardised control rules across the system.

Add a new control category

On the right side of the Control Categories page there is an Add Category button:

Click this button to open the form, capture the details of the new category, then save. The new control category will appear in the list and can be assigned to clients or users according to your access rules.
